alert.note: Alert for Southern Washington (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 11:42AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Washington County through 1230 PM EDT... At 1141 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Cambridge, or 10 miles northwest of Hoosick Falls, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Salem, Cambridge, Greenwich, Cossayuna, West Cambridge, Battenville, Center Falls, Rexleigh, Middle Falls, Eagleville, Anaquassacook, North Cambridge, Fly Summit, Fitch Point, Bald Mountain, Ash Grove, Shushan, Lick Springs, Archdale and East Greenwich. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
